structure_type.name: Document
structure_type.description: Root container for all content in the document
structure_type.usage: Single root element that contains all other structure elements

structure_type.name: Part
structure_type.description: Large-scale division of a document (e.g., Part I, Part II)
structure_type.usage: Use for major document divisions above section level

structure_type.name: Sect
structure_type.usage: Groups related content together (heading + paragraphs + subsections)
structure_type.nesting: Can contain H1-H6, P, List, Table, Figure, and nested Sect elements

structure_type.name: H1
structure_type.usage: Document title, main title, chapter titles

structure_type.name: H2
structure_type.usage: Major section headings

structure_type.name: H3
structure_type.usage: Subsection headings

structure_type.name: H4
structure_type.usage: Sub-subsection headings

structure_type.name: H5
structure_type.usage: Minor section headings

structure_type.name: H6
structure_type.usage: Smallest section headings

structure_type.name: P
structure_type.usage: Body text, standalone paragraphs

structure_type.name: L
structure_type.usage: Contains list items (LI elements)

structure_type.name: LI
structure_type.usage: Individual item within a list
structure_type.parent: Must be child of L element

structure_type.name: Lbl
structure_type.usage: The marker for a list item

structure_type.name: LBody
structure_type.usage: The actual content of a list item

structure_type.name: Table
structure_type.usage: Contains table rows (TR elements)

structure_type.name: TR
structure_type.usage: Row within a table
structure_type.children: Contains TH (header cells) or TD (data cells)

structure_type.name: TH
structure_type.usage: Column or row headers in tables

structure_type.name: TD
structure_type.usage: Regular data cells in tables

structure_type.name: Figure
structure_type.usage: Images, charts, diagrams, photos

structure_type.name: Caption
structure_type.usage: Descriptive text associated with figures/tables

structure_type.name: Note
structure_type.usage: Supplementary notes referenced from main text
structure_type.attributes: ID for cross-referencing from main text

structure_type.name: Reference
structure_type.usage: Links to footnotes, endnotes, bibliography entries, figures

structure_type.name: Link
structure_type.usage: Clickable links to URLs or internal destinations
structure_type.attributes: Href attribute with URL or destination

structure_type.name: Aside
structure_type.usage: Content that is tangentially related to main content (sidebars, callout boxes, key points)

structure_type.name: BlockQuote
structure_type.usage: Extended quotations set apart from main text

structure_type.name: Code
structure_type.usage: Programming code, markup, or technical notation

structure_type.name: Formula
structure_type.usage: Mathematical expressions
structure_type.required_attribute: Alt text with LaTeX or MathML representation

structure_type.name: Artifact
structure_type.description: Non-content elements that should be ignored by assistive technology
structure_type.usage: Page numbers, headers, footers, watermarks, decorative elements, background images

types.type: Layout: Decorative lines, borders, background patterns

mapping.reasoning: Document titles are the highest level heading

mapping.to_structure_type: H2, H3, H4, H5, or H6
mapping.reasoning: Map based on hierarchical_level field from elements analyzer
If in a highlighted box, use Aside; otherwise P
Page numbers are navigation aids, not content
